intro: Pulsatilla alpina f. biscapa, commonly known as the alpine pasqueflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers with prominent, showy stamens. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are palmately divided and covered in a fine, silky hair, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is noted for its limited distribution and is considered a rare botanical curiosity in its native habitat.
